page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: There are three schools in Alford, a Grammar, a Secondary Modern and a Primary. The grammar school was built in 1566. The headmaster is{Mr R. {Rundle.}It has 384 pupils, 23 teachers, 30 pupils in a class and 55 - 65 pupils in a year. Before the grammar school was here it was in the porch of{St. Wilfrids}church in Alford. The children come from Alford and the villages all around like Mablethorpe, Sutton and other places. They get into Alford by bus, car, bicycle and some walk. There are 74 children in the sixth form. Everyone in the fifth year takes O-levels each year and nearly everyone in the upper sixth takes A-levels each year. The school has several benefactors, three of whose names were taken and used for the sports houses,{Spanning, Cecil and {Travers.
